message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.DG, cs.NA, cs.SY 

The paper deals with the problem of representing shapes as currents and the issues that arise due to orientation. It proposes varifolds as an alternative representation for nonoriented shapes. This makes it likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories, as these fields deal with shape representation and analysis. The paper also mentions geometric measure theory, which falls under the discrete geometry (cs.DG) sub-category. The use of varifolds for numerical encoding suggests it could also belong to the numerical analysis (cs.NA) sub-category. Finally, the mention of diffeomorphic registration suggests it could also belong to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category.
